clinical_study.brief_title: Establishment of an Anaesthetic Protocol for Examinations for Children With Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma
clinical_study.official_title: Establishment of an Anaesthetic Protocol for Examinations Under Anaesthesia for Children With Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma - Correlation of Bispectral Index (BIS) and Intraocular Pressure (IOP)

brief_summary.textblock:
Correct measurement of the intraocular pressure of children with glaucoma or suspected glaucoma is essential for diagnosis and therapy.
Despite new non-invasive measurement methods most of the children are uncooperative during the ophthalmological examination. Therefore examination under anaesthesia is needed.
A lot of perioperative factors influence the measurement of intraocular pressure.
Established and safe anaesthetic regimes have been modified regarding these factors. Aim of the study is to evaluate, if a standardized anaesthetic protocol generates reliable and reproducible measured values.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of depth of anesthesia an intraocular pressure
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure is the association between intraocular pressure and bispectral index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bland Altmann Correlation of Applanation tonometry and rebound tonometry
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of two different examination tools

secondary_outcome.measure: Normal range of pediatric intraocular pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Defining the normal range of pediatric intraocular pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the corneal thickness and the intraocular pressure

study_pop.textblock: Children with glaucoma or suspected glaucoma for ophthalmological examination or surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Indication for a general anesthesia (laryngeal mask) and ophthalmological examination and probably surgery
- Children with glaucoma or suspected glaucoma
- ASA classification I-III
- written informed consent of the legal representatives
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication for a laryngeal mask airway
- Known allergy to propofol or remifentanil
